organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Geospatial Program, The National Map Small Scale

metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

title.gco:CharacterString: 100-Meter Resolution Land Cover of the Conterminous United States, 2001

organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Geospatial Program, The National Map Small Scale

otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: These data were downloaded from the National Atlas website (http://www.nationalatlas.gov/atlasftp.html) in August 2014.

collectiveTitle.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States of America, 1997-2014

abstract.gco:CharacterString: This raster layer is a georeferenced image containing land cover data for the conterminous United States, in an Albers Equal-Area Conic projection and at a resolution of 100 meters. The land cover data were derived from the 2001 National Land Cover Database (NLCD) Land Cover data set, a product of the Multi-Resolution Land Characteristics Consortium (MRLC). This layer is part of the 1997-2014 edition of the National Atlas of the United States.

purpose.gco:CharacterString: The 100-meter resolution land cover data were developed to portray the land cover of the United States at 1:1,000,000 scale. They are intended primarily for visual purposes. The original NLCD data should be used for conducting scientific analysis.

credit.gco:CharacterString: U.S. Geological Survey. (2015). 100-Meter Resolution Land Cover of the Conterminous United States, 2001. National Geospatial Program, The National Map Small Scale. Available at: http://purl.stanford.edu/wv372bn9329.

useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the U.S. Geological Survey, no warranty expressed or implied is made by the U.S. Geological Survey regarding the utility of the data on any other system, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. No responsibility is assumed by the U.S. Geological Survey in the use of these data.

title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States of America, 1997-2014

environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.3.1.4959

supplementalInformation.gco:CharacterString: NLCD data sets at 30-meter resolution may be downloaded from the MRLC Web site, http://www.mrlc.gov/nlcd01_data.php. Further information on NLCD, related data sets, and land cover research may be found at the online USGS Land Cover Institute http://landcover.usgs.gov/. Pixel values for land cover data and their corresponding RGB colors are listed in the color ramp (.clr) file that accompanies the data set. This table shows all land cover classes and the RGB color values used to represent them. >Pixel value NLCD 2001 land cover classes R G B >---------------------------------------------------------------------------------- >11 Open water 72 109 162 >12 Perennial ice / snow 229 231 232 >21 Developed, open space 225 205 206 >22 Developed, low intensity 220 152 129 >23 Developed, medium intensity 241 0 0 >24 Developed. high intensity 171 0 0 >31 Barren land 179 175 164 >41 Deciduous forest 107 169 102 >42 Evergreen forest 29 101 51 >43 Mixed forest 189 204 147 >51 Dwarf scrub (Alaska only) 176 151 61 >52 Shrub / scrub 209 187 130 >71 Grassland / herbaceous 215 214 158 >72 Sedge / herbaceous (Alaska only) 209 209 130 >74 Moss (Alaska only) 130 186 158 >81 Pasture hay 221 216 62 >82 Cultivated crops 174 114 41 >90 Woody wetlands 167 196 216 >95 Emergent herbaceous wetlands 113 164 193 >101, 102, 103 Non-U.S. land 240 235 211 >0 Ocean water 193 224 250 Pixel value 101 represents land in Canada or the British Virgin Islands. Pixel value 102 represents land in Mexico or Russia. Pixel value 103 represents land in The Bahamas and Cuba in the southeastern part of the dataset. There are no null values in the image. Included with the GeoTIFF are an auxiliary information file (.aux.xml), an image overview file (.ovr), a value attribute database file (.vat.dbf), a .tfw file (more information included below), a .prj file (more information included below), and an Adobe Color Table (.act) file. The contents of the associated world file (.tfw) are: >100.0 >0.0 >0.0 >-100.0 >-2539950.0 >3257950.0 The projection (.prj) file contains the following information: >PROJCS["Albers_NAD83_L48", >GEOGCS["GCS_North_American_1983", >DATUM["D_North_American_1983", >SPHEROID["GRS_1980",6378137.0,298.257222101]], >PRIMEM["Greenwich",0.0], >UNIT["Degree",0.0174532925199433]], >PROJECTION["Albers"], >PARAMETER["False_Easting",0.0], >PARAMETER["False_Northing",0.0], >PARAMETER["Central_Meridian",-96.0], >PARAMETER["Standard_Parallel_1",29.5], >PARAMETER["Standard_Parallel_2",45.5], >PARAMETER["Latitude_Of_Origin",23.0], >UNIT["Meter",1.0]] Data set extent in meters (Albers Equal-Area Conic projection) >North 3258000 >West -2540000 >East 2441000 >South 119000 There are no NULL or NODATA values in the GeoTIFF. Instead, all land cover values in oceans have been set to zero as part of the masking process. A copy of the land/water mask used in processing is available on request. Information about The National Map Web services can be found on the Web Map and Web Feature Services page; see http://nationalmap.gov/small_scale/infodocs/webservices.html.; {"gdaId" : 7088631}

measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: No tests for logical consistency have been performed on this map layer.
Data completeness reflects the content of the original NLCD data.

description.gco:CharacterString: Four land cover mosaics at 30-meter resolution were downloaded from the MRLC web site and used to produce land cover data files of the conterminous United States, Alaska, Hawaii, and Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands. NLCD stores data for the conterminous United States, Alaska, and Hawaii in the same Albers Equal-Area Conic projection used by the National Atlas. Data for Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands (PRVI) were reprojected to match the Albers projection parameters used by the National Atlas for that area. All data were resampled to 100-meter resolution and extents set to match National Atlas neatlines for the four areas. This map layer includes the data file for the conterminous United States. Using the ArcGIS Feature-to-Raster command, a 0/1 land/water mask for the conterminous United States was created from the 1:1,000,000-scale National Atlas coastline, at the same 100-meter resolution and with the same extent as the land cover data. The land/water mask was applied to the land cover grid with a software routine that used the ArcGIS Multiply command to clip land cover values that fell in ocean areas. The routine used the ArcGIS Nibble command to fill out land cover values to the coastline. The Canadian shoreline of the Great Lakes was extracted from NSFH_2008 and incorporated into the data set used to generate the land/water mask. Ocean areas were set to a pixel value of 0. The land/water mask is available on request. In the conterminous United States land cover data set, non-data pixels were set to separate values: 101 for Canada, 102 for Mexico, and 103 for The Bahamas and Cuba. In Alaska: 101 for Canada and 102 for Russia. In PRVI: 101 for the British Virgin Islands.

title.gco:CharacterString: Atlas of Canada 1,000,000 National Frameworks Data, Hydrology - Drainage Network
